intro: Sebertia gatopensis, commonly known as the Gatombo tree, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, white flowers. The tree produces berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It is often found in moist, lowland forests and is valued for its timber and medicinal properties. The plant also plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and food for various animals.
